kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: NET_OUT_AT_NNI (M552C1)
kpi_info.use: Network out of order (#38). UPDATED:Not updated in NNI.

kpi_info.title: TEMP_FAIL_AT_NNI (M552C2)
kpi_info.use: Temporary failure (#41). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 41. The cause code indicates that the network is not functioning correctly and that the condition is not likely to last for a long period of time. For example, the user may wish to attempt another call almost immediately. UPDATED:In nodal function cases if a connection is requested to be released by Cause No. 41, for example, when an ERQ is received from another AAL type 2 endpoint to a locally blocked path.

kpi_info.title: CONGESTION_AT_NNI (M552C3)
kpi_info.use: Switching equipment congestion (#42). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 42. The cause code indicates that the switching equipment that generates this cause is experiencing a period of high traffic. UPDATED:The counter is updated in nodal function cases if the connection is requested to be released by Cause No. 42, for example, if Window Access Control (WAC) gate access token is rejected for the connection establishment. Counter M552C29 RES_MAN_OVERLOAD_AT_NNI is also updated if the reservation of connection resources does not succeed in the destination AAL2 node. If the verification of binding id does not succeed, counter M552C21 BINDING_ID_VERIF_AT_NNI is also updated.

kpi_info.title: REQ_CHAN_AT_NNI (M552C4)
kpi_info.use: Requested circuit/channel not available (#44). Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: RES_UNAVAIL_AT_NNI (M552C5)
kpi_info.use: Resource unavailable unspecified (#47). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 47. This cause is used to report a resource unavailable event only when no other cause in the resource unavailable class applies. UPDATED:When the requested AAL2 path is blocked and the checking of the path does not succeed, or when the requested AAL2 path is blocked and unblocking does not succeed.

kpi_info.title: AAL_PARA_AT_NNI (M552C6)
kpi_info.use: AAL parameters cannot be supported (#93). Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_MSG_AT_NNI (M552C7)
kpi_info.use: Invalid message (#95). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 95. This cause is used to report an invalid message event only when no other cause in the invalid message class applies. UPDATED:When an AAL2 message has invalid or unrecognized parameters.

kpi_info.title: MANDAT_INFO_AT_NNI (M552C8)
kpi_info.use: Mandatory information element is missing (#96). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 96. This cause indicates that the equipment sending the cause has received a message which is missing an information element which must be present in the message before the message can be processed. UPDATED:When a mandatory information element is missing from an AAL2 message.

kpi_info.title: MSG_NOT_IMPL_AT_NNI (M552C9)
kpi_info.use: Message type non-existent or not implemented (#97). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 97. The cause indicates that the equipment sending the cause has received a message with a message type which it does not recognise either because it is not defined, or is defined but not implemented by the equipment. UPDATED:When an AAL2 message is received for an already established connection, but is not recognised.

kpi_info.title: INFO_NOT_IMPL_AT_NNI (M552C10)
kpi_info.use: inated by Cause No. 99. This indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements/parameters not recognized because the information element identifiers/parameter names are not defined, or are defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause. This cause indicates that the information elements/parameters were discarded. However, the information element is not required in the message for the equipment sending the cause to process the message. UPDATED:When a message which includes unrecognized not implemented information elements/parameters is received.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_INFO_AT_NNI (M552C11)
kpi_info.use: Invalid information element contents (#100). Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_ERQ_AT_NNI (M552C12)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on ERQ_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 establish request. Establish request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to start the establishment of a new AAL type 2 connection. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to an ERQ message within the defined timeframe. The time is fixed by the system as 30 seconds.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_REL_AT_NNI (M552C13)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on REL_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 release request. The Release request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to start the clearing of an AAL type 2 connection. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to a REL message within the defined timeframe. The time is fixed by the system as 60 seconds.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_RES_AT_NNI (M552C14)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on RES_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 reset request. Reset request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to reset a particular channel, all channels on a particular AAL type 2 path, or all channels on all AAL type 2 paths between two nodes to the "Idle" state and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to a RES message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the reset request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_BLO_AT_NNI (M552C15)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on BLO_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 block request. Block request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally block a particular, unblocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to a BLO message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the blocking request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_UBL_AT_NNI (M552C16)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on UBL_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 unblock request. Unblock request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally unblock a particular, blocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer entity does not answer to a UBL message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the unblocking request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: MSG_UNRECOG_AT_NNI (M552C17)
kpi_info.use: Message with an unrecognised parameter, discarded (#110). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 110. This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has discarded a received message which includes a parameter that is not recognised. UPDATED:When an AAL2 signalling message is discarded because of an unrecognised parameter.

kpi_info.title: SAI_ALLOC_AT_NNI (M552C18)
kpi_info.use: Originating Signalling Association Identifier (OSAI) allocation failure. An internal resource reservation fails for AAL2 connection establishment. Internal (nonprotocol) error. UPDATED:When internal resources for AAL2 signalling processing cannot be reserved.

kpi_info.title: CID_VERIF_AT_NNI (M552C19)
kpi_info.use: CID verification/allocation failure. Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: AAL2PI_VERIF_AT_NNI (M552C20)
kpi_info.use: AAL type 2 Id verification/allocation failure. Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: BINDING_ID_VERIF_AT_NNI (M552C21)
kpi_info.use: Binding id verification failure. The requested binding identifier was not available in the destination AAL type 2 node. Internal (non-protocol) error. UPDATED:If the verification of binding id does not succeed; the error code counter M552C3 CONGESTION is also updated.

kpi_info.title: LINK_CHAR_VERIF_AT_NNI (M552C22)
kpi_info.use: Required traffic characterizations unavailable. Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: ADJ_NODE_NOT_AVAIL_AT_NNI (M552C23)
kpi_info.use: Adjacent node not available. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: COMMON_AT_NNI (M552C24)
kpi_info.use: The number of connection events started in the AAL2 signalling. UPDATED:The counter is updated when an AAL2 connection establishment request ERQ (Establishment Request) message is received (incoming). The counter is updated also when an ERQ message sending request is received (outgoing).

kpi_info.title: NODAL_FUNCTION_AT_NNI (M552C25)
kpi_info.use: The number of nodal function transit connection events started in AAL2 signaling. This counter is valid only for MGW. UPDATED:The counter is updated when an ERQ (Establishment Request) message sending request is received (transit).

kpi_info.title: UNALLOC_NUMB_AT_NNI (M552C26)
kpi_info.use: Unallocated (unassigned) number (#1). This counter provides the number of the connections terminated by Cause No. 1. It indicates that the called party cannot be reached because, although the called party number is in a valid format, it is not currently allocated (assigned). This counter is valid only for MGW. UPDATED:In MGW nodal function cases if a connection is requested to be released by Cause No. 1, for example, a connection with incoming resources is requested to be released because of an error in the analysed address of the destination AAL2 node.

kpi_info.title: NO_ROUTE_AT_NNI (M552C27)
kpi_info.use: No route to destination (#3). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 3. This indicates that the called party cannot be reached because the network through which the call has been routed does not serve the destination desired. This counter is valid only for MGW. UPDATED:In MGW nodal function cases if a connection is requested to be released by Cause No. 3, for example, a connection with incoming resources is requested to be released because of an error in the analysis of the destination AAL2 node address.

kpi_info.title: NO_CHANNEL_AT_NNI (M552C28)
kpi_info.use: No circuit or channel available (#34). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 34. This indicates that at the moment there is no appropriate circuit or channel available to handle the call. UPDATED:In nodal function cases if a connection is requested to be released by Cause No. 34, for example, a connection with incoming resources is requested to be released because of an error in the outgoing resources reservation.

kpi_info.title: RES_MAN_OVERLOAD_AT_NNI (M552C29)
kpi_info.use: Resource manager overload. Connection establishment is rejected because resource manager overload protection is activated in the destination AAL type 2 node. UPDATED:When a Window Access Control (WAC) gate access token is rejected for connection establishment. The error code counter M552C3 CONGESTION_AT_NNI is also updated.

kpi_info.title: OUT_ERQ_ATTEMPT_AT_NNI (M552C30)
kpi_info.use: The number of outgoing AAL2 connection establishment requests. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Establishment Request (ERQ) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_ERQ_SUCCESS_AT_NNI (M552C31)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful outgoing AAL2 connection establishments. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Establishment Confirm (ECF) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_ERQ_ATTEMPT_AT_NNI (M552C32)
kpi_info.use: The number of incoming AAL2 connection establishment requests. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Establishment Request (ERQ) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_ERQ_SUCCESS_AT_NNI (M552C33)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful incoming AAL2 connection establishments. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Establishment Confirm (ECF) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_MOD_ATTEMPT_AT_NNI (M552C34)
kpi_info.use: The number of outgoing AAL2 connection modification requests. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Modification Request (MOD) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_MOD_SUCCESS_AT_NNI (M552C35)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful outgoing AAL2 connection modifications. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Modification Acknowledge (MOA) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_MOD_ATTEMPT_AT_NNI (M552C36)
kpi_info.use: The number of incoming AAL2 connection modification requests. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Modification Request (MOD) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_MOD_SUCCESS_AT_NNI (M552C37)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful incoming AAL2 connection modifications. UPDATED:When an AAL2 Modification Acknowledge (MOA) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_RES_AT_NNI (M552C38)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of an unavailable resource. UPDATED:When an AAL2 modification fails due to an unavailable internal ATM resource.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_INT_AT_NNI (M552C39)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of an internal error. UPDATED:When an AAL2 modification fails due to an internal error.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_COLL_AT_NNI (M552C40)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed ALL2 connection modifications because of a collision. UPDATED:When AAL2 modification fails due to a collision.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_REM_AT_NNI (M552C41)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of a failed remote. UPDATED:When an AAL2 modification fails due to a failed remote.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_MOD_AT_NNI (M552C42)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of a timer expiring. UPDATED:When an AAL2 modification fails because a timer waiting for a Modification Acknowledge (MOD) message expires
